updater.selfupdater
Class SoftwareSelfUpdater

java.lang.Object
  updater.selfupdater.SoftwareSelfUpdater

public class SoftwareSelfUpdater
extends java.lang.Object

This is a self updater used by software launcher. When the launcher encounter any files that it can't do a replacement due to file locking, then this will be used. The launcher will launch this and exit (to release the file lock on the itself), then this self updater will do the replacement according to a list the launcher give it.

Author:
Chan Wai Shing

Field Detail

test

protected static final boolean test
Indicate whether it is in test mode or not.

maxExecutionTime

protected static long maxExecutionTime
The maximum execution time allowed (in ms). When the self updater failed, it will not give up immediately, because the launcher may not exit so quickly after launching this. In this case, the program will keep trying until this maximum execution time is reached. This is configurable by replacing/editing '/config.xml' inside the jar, for more information, see the code below.

Constructor Detail

SoftwareSelfUpdater

protected SoftwareSelfUpdater()
Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
The format of the replacement file:

One row for destination file path (0), one row for new file path (1), one row for the path to place/move the destination file (2).
Flow: 0->2, 1->0

Example:

C:\software\dest.txt
C:\tmp\1.tmp
C:\tmp\1.old
C:\software\dest.jar
C:\tmp\2.tmp
C:\tmp\2.old
(a new line character here)

Parameters:
args - 0: lock folder path, 1: replacement file path, start from 2: command and arguments to launch the software.

renameFile

public static boolean renameFile(java.io.File from,
                                 java.io.File to,
                                 int timeout,
                                 int retryDelay)
Rename the file from to to within timeout milli seconds.

Parameters:
from - the position to move from
to - the position to move to
timeout - the maximum execution time in milli second
retryDelay - the time delay in milli second between each retry, must >= 0
Returns:
true if rename succeed, false if rename failed
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - retryDelay < 0

updateMaxExecutionTime

protected static void updateMaxExecutionTime()
Get and update the maximum execution time from /config.xml inside the jar if there is any.

                                         int timeout,
                                         int retryDelay)
Acquire a exclusive lock on the file with retry.

Parameters:
fileToLock - the file to lock
timeout - the retry timeout
retryDelay - the time to sleep between retries
Returns:
the lock if acquired successfully, null if failed
